title: How to Make As Easy As Bing Cherry Pie

steps.headline: Remove the refrigerated pie crust from its wrapper.
Pit the fresh California Bing cherries.
steps.description: You may wish to use a simple cherry pitting tool (available at most grocery stores) and wear an apron to protect your clothes from juice spatter.

steps.headline: Combine the pitted cherries in a bowl with sugar and tapioca flour.
steps.description: Mix well and spoon into the prepared pie crust.

steps.headline: Combine the crumb topping ingredients in a small bowl and mix until evenly distributed and crumbly.
steps.description: Sprinkle over the top of the filling.

steps.headline: Place in the oven and bake at 400 °F (204 °C) for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Reduce temperature to 325 °F (163 °C) and bake for another 30 to 40 minutes until bubbly and browned on top. Allow to cool to room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5e\/Make-As-Easy-As-Bing-Cherry-Pie-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5e\/Make-As-Easy-As-Bing-Cherry-Pie-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.7647058823529,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Remove the refrigerated pie crust from its wrapper. Pit the fresh California Bing cherries. You may wish to use a simple cherry pitting tool (available at most grocery stores) and wear an apron to protect your clothes from juice spatter. Combine the pitted cherries in a bowl with sugar and tapioca flour. Mix well and spoon into the prepared pie crust. Combine the crumb topping ingredients in a small bowl and mix until evenly distributed and crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the filling. Place in the oven and bake at 400 °F (204 °C) for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 325 °F (163 °C) and bake for another 30 to 40 minutes until bubbly and browned on top. Allow to cool to room temperature.
